Package jhd.DistanceMaps.libJ8

Contains Functions for computing distance transforms in 2D and 3D images.
1. Computing the exact 2D and 3D Euclidean distance map (EDM) using Danielsson's algorithm.
     Danielsson P.E. Euclidean distance mapping. Computer Graphics Image Processing, 14, 1980, pp. 227-248.
2. Computing the 2D and 3D geodesic distance transform (GDT) by serial propagation.
3. Drawing Euclidean spheres.

Classic_EDM.java - An ImageJ plugin that computes the EDM based on a unit pixel/voxel. It provides both integer and exact floating point algorithms.
True_EDM_Lib.java - An ImageJ plugin that calls the jhd.DistanceLib for computing the exact EDM using true length anisotropic pixels/voxels.
True_EDM_V1.java - An ImageJ plugin for computing the exact EDM using true length anisotropic pixels/voxels.
Classic_Euclidean_Spheres.java - An ImageJ plugin for drawing unit pixel/voxel Euclidean spheres (i.e) sqrt(x^2 + y^2 + z^2) < R.
True_Euclidean_Spheres_Lib.java - An ImageJ plugin that calls the jhd.DistanceLib for drawing anisotropic true length pixel/voxel Euclidean spheres (i.e) sqrt(x^2 + y^2 + z^2) < R.

Due to large memory requirements these functions all modify the input image array.

  • Class Summary
    Class Description
    EuclideanSpheres
    Class for drawing Euclidean spheres scaled in image units
    EuclideanSpheres.RandomSphereParams
    Nested class to simplify random sphere draw arguments list
    int pixWidth, pixHeight and pixDepth are the pixel dimensions in user units (cm, inches etc.).
    EuclideanSpheres.SphereParams
    Nested class to simplify sphere draw arguments list
    pixWidth, pixHeight and pixDepth are the pixel dimensions in user units (cm, inches etc.).
    ExactEuclideanMap
    Functions for computing the exact 2D and 3D Euclidean distance using Danielsson's algorithm.
    GDT3D
    Geodesic distance and tortuosity of binarized (0-255) images and volumes by propagation
    GDT3D.Point3D
    Experimental class for organizing 3D pixel information
    GeodesicTransformer
    A class for computing 2D and 3D geodesic transforms
